Data report

data_report.categorical_column_report(data: DataFrame, column: str, report_string: list[str]) → None[source]
data_report.create_initial_data_report(data: DataFrame, print_to_console: bool = True, save_to_file: bool = False, filename: str = 'initial_data_report') → None[source]

Create the initial data report containing basic information about each of the columns in the provided dataframe. Information in the report consist of: number of rows, number of columns, data type of the column, number of non-null values. Additionally, for numeric columns:

  • mean

  • median

  • mode

  • lowest value, 25,50,75-percentile, max value

For categorical columns:

  • number of unique values

  • modes

  • frequency of most common value

Parameters:

  • data – DataFrame object containing data in question

  • print_to_console – Option to print the report to the console, defaults to True

  • save_to_file – Option to save the report to the file, defaults to False

  • filename – Option to change the location to which the file is saved, defaults to “initial_data_report”

Returns:

data_report.numeric_column_report(data: DataFrame, column: str, report_string: list[str]) → None[source]
